After his father’s passing, Sahobidin has been trying to start his own business so that he can earn money and provide for the family. He would like to be involved in sales and sell dried fruit. But in order to start a new business, he needs support. Therefore he is applying for a loan. He hopes that you will be able to help him. You can help him to have regular work.

Fotima, 55, is from Isfara. She is divorced and has raised her son all by herself. Her son is 21 years old. He is a good person, independent and caring. He earns a living by renovating houses. Fotima started earning a living after her divorce. She is a tailor who makes clothing for women. She works from home. She is an experienced and talented tailor with many customers. Everyone knows her. She is planning to renovate her house and to improve living conditions and needs your help. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy construction materials and other supplies.

Khydija was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 45 years old, married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

Isabel is a single woman, who is a spirited fighter. She was not able to have any university education due to the living conditions at that time.

The need to earn money and the lack of job opportunities caused her to start her business, but her mental strength, determination and desire to progress are what keep her fighting every day, winning, with strength and honesty, the money that keeps her accounts up to date.

With the intention to continue making progress, and to have an ample and abundant range of goods, Isabel is requesting this loan to buy grocery, household and personal care products. This money will be used to promote the sale of toiletries in her business, which has been declining over time.

Leidy has been able to gather up wonderful, great experiences in her life. One of those experiences is that she has been able to work in different grocery stores in the municipality of Medellín.

She is a loving, responsible mother, and the meaning of family is very present in her productive process.

Leidy was always very active and had a great vocation in service--qualities that motivated the opening of her own grocery store. The store is very well recognized in the area.

Today she is a friendly and very entrepreneurial woman, always looking for alternatives so that her clients can feel well-attended and buy products of quality.

She seeks economic support to obtain a loan to buy a display cabinet and an assortment of cold cuts for her store.

Her greatest dream is to have a great distributor of convenience store items, and she considers that little by little, and with the help of Corporación Interactuar, she will able to realize that dream.

Eugenia is a very resourceful 49 year old woman who works selling merchandise, mainly women's accessories. Her business grew out of financial need. She has two sons to fight for, a house she wants to build, and a future she is hoping to realize and, in spite of having no job opportunities or an education, she is optimistic and wants to work. So she came up with a way to generate income and day after day she gives her all to succeed.

In order to increase her income this December Eugenia is requesting a loan to buy a variety of women's accessories, namely costume jewelry and hand bags.

Andranik is 24 years old and he lives with his parents in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He also has two sisters who are already married and they live with their families. Andranik has no higher education but as he mentions he managed to find a job which is very interesting for him and he manages it great pleasure; he works at the city rescue center.

Andranik’s father is a constructor and he decided to do some repairing of their flat, since the last time that it has been repaired was 15 years ago. Andranik greatly wants to help his father somehow, but since he works all day long and in repairing works he just does not manage to help him, he decided to support his father financially. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Andranik asks for the repairs to their flat which will be of great help for his father.

Artyom is 43 years old and he lives with his two sons and his nice wife in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Artyom works at the city’s police station as a policeman. His wife is also employed and she works at the factory of dairy-products as a cheese maker. They have two school-aged sons.

Artyom wants till the New Year’s holidays to do some repairing of his flat, making it nicer and cleaner. He has some savings and he will be very happy if Kiva lenders help him with this loan amount of 700.000 Armenian drams to do the repairing of his flat quickly and accurately, making it more comfortable for his family.

Azniv is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and two children. Both Azniv and her husband are accountants. Azniv’s husband till today works of his profession. Azniv now works at the rest house in Sevan city and simultaneously runs farming. Azniv’s son is employed and he works at the bank and her daughter is a student.

Azniv’s husband a month ago stared repairing of their house but now he is short of money and a lot of works remain half done. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Azniv asks in order to help her husband financially and to manage to complete the repairs to their house for the New Year’s holidays.

Gorik is 35 years old and he is engaged in farming in his native village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. Gorik has a large family and here he is the only-bread winner. He lives with his wife, three daughters, his sister and retired mother. Except Gorik no one from the family is employed and Gorik is all day long and very seriously engaged in farming and agriculture in order to cover his large family’s needs.

On his farm he has cows, calves, heifers, pigs, horses and a lot of chickens. With the help of his mother and wife Gorik sells his farms milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. Gorik is also manages potato cultivation the sale of which is of great profit from him as he sells it right from his farm to re-sellers with rather good price.

Gorik has plans of his farm’s livestock number enlargement and this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he asks for the purchase of one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle for winter long months.

Arsen is 23 years old and he lives with his mother and brother in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Arsen has vocational education with the specialty of electric and does different works of his specialty and also constructional works by order. He is also engaged in farming and agriculture and is his farm he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, rabbits and chickens. This young farmer is very laborious and working hard and all day long and he manages to have a good income from his farming. Arsen with the help of his mother organizes the sale of his farm products such as milk, meat, macun (national dairy-products), eggs and rabbits.

Arsen has plans of his farm enlargement and he is hopeful that thanks to his first Kiva loan he will manage to realize his plans. Now he asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

Nancy is a 33-year-old businesswoman, lives in Turbo, and makes a living tending to a grocery store business (a typical neighborhood store).

She started her business in early 2014. The first year was a period of exploration and experimentation, and now she has enough experience and has noted the buying behavior of the customers. She wants to make an investment to stock the most demanded products.

Thinking of starting 2016 in the best way, with an expanded inventory and directed toward the people in her neighborhood, Ms. Nancy wants to request a loan to purchase grains, food, personal care products and domestic products, hoping to get as a result growth in revenue and maintain prices to retain her customers.

Cruz is a mother of two. About seven ago, she started her own retail business. She did so because she needed to generate resources in order to provide for her family, and she learned through practice. She offers all sorts of products like accessories and costume jewelry. Her main advantage is that she meets new people every day and offers them her products. Her sales are steadily improving.

She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale merchandise, such as purses, accessories, fragrances, and other items. This will allow her to offer more variety in her stock and meet the holidays' increased demand, which will in turn improve her income level.

Cruz is dedicated and wants to keep working hard to keep her business going. Her goal is to be able to set up shop in a retail space sometime in the near future. That would allow her to offer a wider array of items, which would translate into more profitability and financial stability. She wants to be able to give her children an excellent education and a better quality of life.

Anees is a 38 year old, married woman. She is involved in a cloth trade business. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from a city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Anees has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business tand increase her earnings with her loan

Jorge is 46 years old and he is a father of 2 kids.

He works as a driver and he pays rent. He needs a loan to fix his car.

Jorge would like to buy a house for his family in the future. He hopes that you can help him because he is the only support for his family.

Lowelyn is 40 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are still in school. Lowelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lowelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, noodles, spices, bread, and other snack foods.

Lowelyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Ivon is a very entrepreneurial woman who looks forward to getting ahead and progressing.

For the past 4 years she has been making a living selling, through catalogue, products such as clothes, complements, beauty products and household items. She primarily sells to friends, neighbors and family members who know her and also want her to succeed in her business.

Ever since she was a young girl she liked merchandising and sales which is why she is now so talented in this field, thanks to her friendliness and wonderful quality of service.

She requests a loan to buy an assortment of beauty products and clothing to increase her stock and improve her sales, so that she can obtain a good income for her household.

She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the help of good-hearted people who support this type of project, along with the Corporation Interactuar.

Maria is 46 years old and lives in her own house with her family unit. She has worked selling personal use products for more than 10 years. Her business is located in her house and she also sells itinerantly in the different neighborhoods. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of perfume, lotion, cream, shampoo, deodorants, etc. wholesale. In this way she can continue with her work to make greater income.

Garnik is 32 years old and with his wife and two small, cheerful sons live in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Garnik has no higher education and some specialty but he is very hard working man and he manages to provide his young family with good living conditions thanks to his fruit and vegetable trading business.

Garnik is re-seller. He buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers, the assortment of citrus fruits he also brings from Georgia and all these on his own car he drives about the city and sells.

Garnik with coming of winter, wants to prepare his car for his cold season and usually he takes care of it very properly since by the help of this car he earns on hi family living. So with this loan of 600.000 Armenian drams he is going to buy winter tires for his far and he will also settle gas balloon on his car, on this way he can also reduce his expenses on petrol use.

In Kapan city of Syunik region lives Gyulnara with her retired husband. Gyulnara has two daughters and a son. All of them are already married and they live with their families. Gyulnara has vocational education and a specialty of accountant. Many years she worked at the bank as an accountant now she also works of her profession at the school. Gyulnara is the employed in her family since her husband is a pensioner.

This loan of 300.000 Armenian drams she needs for the purchase of computer since she would like also to manage some part of her work at her house also, since working only at the school she does not manage to finish her daily accountancy work properly.

Karen very quickly ended his first Kiva loan repayment and already has an idea for his second Kiva deal. He lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region with his wife and two sons who help him greatly with the farm work. Here he has cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep and lambs and his wife makes and also organizes the sale of his farm’s milk, butter, cheese, meat and also eggs. Karen, step-by-step developed his farm and made it richer with livestock, of course with the help of his Kiva loan.

This time, Karen plans to spend this loan of 700.000 Armenian dram on the purchase of one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle for the long winter period.

Aramayis is a policeman living in Ijevan town. He also studies at the university in the Economic department, as well as works at the local police station. Aramayis lives with his parents, his father works at local wine factory and his mother is a seller in the nearby shop.

Aramayis works hard to manage his studies and work at the same time. He has applied for this loan to pay for the university tuition and to receive a Bachelor's degree in Economics.

This will help him to enrich his educational background and be considered for higher degrees in his work as a policeman.

Mikhael is from Gosh village of the Tavush region, where he lives with his parents. Mikhael is studying his second course at the Institute of Physical Culture, specializing in sports pedagogy. Together with his studies, Mikhael provides karate classes for local children in the village. His parents sell different accessories near the house, and Mikhael supports them with that business as well.

As a hardworking and enthusiastic man, Mikhael tries hard to manage his studies and work so that he will have a strong educational background and practice behind him when the time comes to find a well-paid job.

Mikhael asks lenders to support him with the university tuition, so he would be able to earn his Bachelor's degree from the Faculty of Sport Pedagogy.

He hopes for lenders' support and goodwill, so financial difficulties will not be a burden for his professional career.

Michael, 27 years old, is an enthusiastic, hardworking young man who is dedicated to his studies. Michael decided to study public accounting and finance at the Universidad Paulo Freire, where he is currently studying in his fourth year of his major. He decided to study this major because he hopes to one day have his own accounting firm.

Michael has studied these four years of his major on Sundays, because during the week he works going around the streets of Managua to sell iced drinks. In this way, he has helped out his parents with the family business that is already five years old. Thanks to this, he has improved his family's economy and has been able to pay for his studies with his parents' help.

Michael is about to realize his first dream, his university degree. He needs to buy a laptop to be able to manage his last years of study and thanks to Mi Crédito and Kiva, he now has it. He guarantees that his new computer will be a very useful tool in preparing his specialized work.

In the future Michael wants to first settle his debt with the funder and later study a specialization in taxes.

Clementine is a group leader, 45 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 11 and 20 years. They all attend schools. The group is called INDATWA which means “The Great” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their business for the better future.

Clementine sells soft drinks and has been doing in a business for the past 8 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum in order to make soft drinks for selling. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

Luz is continuing with her bakery business (in the photo she is on the left, wearing a horizontally striped shirt and blue pants). With her previous loan, she bought an industrial oven to increase her production.  She made her payments on time, because her bakery produced enough bread to generate the income she needed.  Now her bakery is producing every day of the week.  She bakes 2 times a day, and she varies her production according to the type of flour available in the market.  She has daily customers, and she also sells at wholesale to the small stores in the mornings.  She states,"we work every day so that our customers never lack for bread."  

The success of Luz's bakery is due to the investment she made which is enabling her to increase the volume of her bread production.  The advantage of her business is that she sells both at retail and wholesale.  The disadvantage is that she lacks capital to buy supplies such as flours made of cassava root, corn and wheat.  Her dream is to have a bakery in a building outside her home.  She wants to buy flour at wholesale so that she can fill her daily orders.  This is the 5th loan that she has taken with the institution in the 8 years that she has been developing this business.

This is why Luz is requesting a loan to buy flour at wholesale so that she can have the supplies she needs to fill her daily orders.

The borrowers belong to the Señor Manuel Exaltacion communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Mollepata, which belongs to Anta province and Cusco department.

The borrower, Elena, is 42 years old and has 2 children who she cares for and struggles for daily. The borrower works at her business selling groceries in her little store. She sells soft drinks, noodles and cookies. The borrower's desires is to get ahead and for this she needs to expand her business.

The borrower asked for the loan to purchase noodles, soft drinks and cookies.

The other borrowers work at a business selling grains, a business selling animals, a grocery store business and a restaurant business. The borrower who is attached to the group photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

The borrowers are grateful and happy with the Kiva lenders for continuing to trust in them.

The "Banca Estrellas" communal bank continues to work together. The loan they received helped them to buy merchandise, pay their services and remodel their work spaces.

Nieves continues to work selling toys (She is the second on the left wearing the black sweater and flowered apron). The loan she received was used to buy seasonal merchandise. Her payments were punctual as the sales for the end of the year are continuous.

At present her business has stabilized. She has constant clients and continuous sales, the variety of merchandise has influenced her clients to return to make their Christmas purchases. The children know the store and know it is a place they can find what they want. "Little by little I have improved my income and my business", she commented. The success of her business is due to her taking advantage the coming of the year end season to offer good promotions.

The advantage of her business is that she has strong sales for the season, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock her business. Her dream is to stabilize her business. She wants to buy merchandise, seasonal toys, to promote her seasonal sales. This is her fifth loan with the Institute in the nine years she has been in this business.

It is for these reasons Nieves is requesting a loan to buy toys to promote her seasonal sales.

Leanguoy is an 18-year-old single freshman who is from the Kandal Province of Cambodia. He is also pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Economics at a university in the city. His family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming for revenue. Now he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees, so he would like to take out a loan. With this loan he will be able to graduate successfully and achieve his dreams.

In the future, Leanguoy is going to run his own business. He also wants to build a house for his family and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if he can support it.

Elizabeth is a married mother with three school children. She's in her mid 30's and she runs a shop that sells second hand clothes and shoes. She works from 10 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth' tenth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to reinvest in the same business of selling used clothes. Elizabeth managed to pay all her loans successfully and she Appreciates KIVA for the support given to their group.

Elizabeth used her profit to pay school fees for her school children, cover household expenses, reinvest in her business and to care for the family. She will use this loan to buy a new stock of second hand clothes for sale during the Christmas festivals.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Upendo oysterbay" which comprises of 6 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back all of  the loan.

Juan, 39, lives and works in a communal home and on communal land. He is married, and together they have three children who depend on them and attend the local elementary school. They live in the city of Muyupampa in the Chuquisacaregion of the Luis Calvo province. His main job is growing peanuts, which he was trained to do through the Nor Sud Intercultural Foundation. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase peanut seeds and agrochemicals, and to prepare his land for farming. These investments will allow him to continue his work and generate new income since this region produces a high amount of peanuts.  This will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

The "Playa Verde" lending group will enter its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of their Centro Focal Panamericana (Pan-American Regional Office). The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Constancia is the president. The members of the lending group are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling water, selling quinoa juice, selling blankets, and food sales.

This loan will help small businesswomen in Constancia's group. Constancia states that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, having been invited by one of the institution's facilitator. She currently has a business selling quinoa juice. She comments that she learned this trade from her godmother and decided to start her own business a few years ago.

The loan that they are requesting will allow her to increase her capital (ie., purchasing a quintal of quinoa) by purchasing from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. After making her juice, she will sell it in her store. This line of work allows her to earn an income with which to support her family financially since she is a single mother of two. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the training offered by the institution.

Nasreen is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns an retail business in which he offers different products such as decoration pcs, kitchen accessories and cosmetics to a private firm. He sells different types of products. Her husband wants to grow his business and wants to offer more products to the firms, but he does not have enough capital for investment. So Nasreen requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan her husband will buy more products to sell to the firms.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Ulysses is 32 years old, married with 2 children, settled for a living at Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He works as a security guard, and at the same time had a motor transport business to make a living. He has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for almost ten years and used his previous loan for buying spare parts and motor accessories. It has been successfully repaid.

To maintain a better service, he took a new loan 20,000.00 to purchase a pair of tires and for maintenance costs and motor improvements. He wants to improve the general living of his family in the near future and dreams to build his own house.

Zareena is 40 years old, married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Zareena makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Zareena wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

Sajida  is 34 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Sajida  has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

Argenis is 29 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives in the municipality of Medellín with her beloved husband and her son who is 7 years old and who she loves more than everything. In order to help her family she decided to start a restaurant 12 years ago, something that has turned to a great part of her life. 

There’s a lot of competition in her location and she hopes she can improve her business by increasing her sales and making her restaurant last in time, so she can keep providing for her family. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy a new stove to cook and more inputs to make food. 

Argenis dreams with having her own house so she expects that her restaurant will help her accomplish that. You can also help her achieve this and more with just a loan.

Freider is a 22-year-old youth and father of one daughter. Currently, he works as a miner and it has not been easy to find new employment opportunities. For this reason, and with the possibility of generating an income on his own, he wishes to begin his own business, a grocery store. He is motivated to request a loan to invest in the purchase of durable goods (stands and display cases) and stock in bulk (vegetables, grains, pastas, hygiene products and other staple goods). This will give him the possibility of beginning his business idea, with which he hopes to attract many customers so that they recognize the quality of his products and the service that he offers. This last will be the differentiating factor that will make him increase his clientele little by little, and as a result, his sales.

Freider is active, enterprising, and thriving. Day by day he is in search of new possibilities to open doors to progress and improve his living conditions and thus advance to reach his main dream, which is to have a minimarket, well-known, profitable, and sustainable over time. With it he hopes to generate new employment opportunities.

Diego has been a very dedicated young man, always looking after his family. He has always liked to work as an independent businessman. He started selling merchandise five years ago. His customers are neighbors, family members and friends from the area. He works alone every day in his business. He finds an advantage of his job is that he is able to look after his family and at the same time he is able to be productive as a businessman.

Currently, he is requesting the loan to purchase a selection of clothes and shoes wholesale because it is a great opportunity for this time of the year. This will allow him to stock up on a greater selection to satisfy the demand, which increases during the Christmas season. This will result in obtaining a better income for his family.

Diego mentions that his greatest wish is to be able to continue to support his family financially.

Carmen is a 47-year-old woman who for some time has made a living through diverse lines of work but always with the desire in mind to move into the commercial area. In 2012, she opened her own business, offering personal care products.

Carmen characterizes herself as an entrepreneurial woman, friendly, with a vision and many hopes to get ahead. By this, she is encouraged to request a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as deodorants, creams, lotions, tonics, among others, with the goal of creating a better image for the business, of attracting more clients, and offering a variety of products that will satisfy the needs and tastes of all who visit the business.

In this way she will be able to obtain revenue to continue contributing to the economy of her household and save to install various branches of her business and to have a more prosperous future, where she will be able to markedly improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Mohammad is a married man from Gaza City. He has 5 kids ranging in age from 3 to 11 years old.

He runs a barber shop in Khanyounes. He has been running this business for four years. This store is the only source of income for Mohammad's family. Mohammad says that the main challenges for his business are the continuous blackouts of the electricity, and the high competition in the market.

Mohammad has requested the loan to buy new equipment for the salon. The extra income from this loan will help him enhance his family's standards of living. In the future he plans to expand his business. Mohammad thanks you for your support.

Marcelina is a 46 year old woman, she is divorced and has a 23 year old son. Her business is selling fruit.
She is friendly, strong and very hardworking. Her business is mobile and she travels to different villages in the Altiplano that are characterized by a dry, cold and very inhospitable environment, with almost non-existent vegetation.
Marcelina has a dark complexion and dresses traditionally (hat, sweater and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará which she speaks at home as well as in the villages she visits. She speaks Spanish in the general population. She shares her life with her son, who is a police officer. They live in her son's home which is rented and made of bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The home has drinking water, electricity and plumbing.
Her business is selling seasonal fruit such as: bananas, papaya, apples, pineapples and others. She sells them by travelling to remote villages that do no have these fruits. She sells them wholesale as well as at retail price. "I began selling in a village where I have family, and seeing the good sales, I ventured to villages farther away", she comments.
Her business is successful because the villages that she visits do not produce fruit. The advantage of the business is that she makes good daily sales; the disadvantage is the abrupt changes in the weather. Her dream is to have a greater quantity of fruit and to buy a permanent stand to sell from. She wants to buy fruit wholesale to increase her merchandise. This is her first loan from the institution since she began her business 10 years ago.
It is for these reasons that Marcelina is requesting a loan, to buy fruit wholesale to sell in remote villages.

Bajram is a villager in his late 50's and a married father of two with one of the sons being born with late development and also with his wife who is not healthy and receives some monthly disability income of $141, according to Bajram. In the four dynym that his family owns and that he takes care of it 100%, he plants it mostly with fodder for the dairy cow and a calf they have and also some seasonal veggies and orchards that they use them for their family consumption. They only sell a calf a year for roughly $450. Another income for the family is the disability income for the disabled son of $61/month and a little pay of the other son who works in a nearby gas station as much as $104/month.

The loan that Bajram is requesting from you will be used to build a fence around the four dynym agricultural land.

Pedro is 34 years old and currently lives at home and works on communal land. He has a wife and together they have 3 children who are dependant on them, they are all studying two at primary level and the other in secondary school in the community. They live in Chuquisaca department in the Luis Calvo department, Muyupampa municipality. 

His main activity is the production of peanut, given that he relies on training in this field from the intercultural foundation Nor Sud.

This is why he requires a loan, it will be used to buy peanut seeds, and agricultural chemicals for the land. With this he will undertake this activity and thus be able to generate more income due to improving production efficiency, through this he will be able to improve his living conditions and his daily life with his children and wife.

Faustino, 26, lives in a communal home and works on communal land.  He is married and has two children. One of his sons attends the local elementary school and his other son is three years old. They live in the city of Muyupampa, in the Chuquisaca region or the Luis Calvo province. 

Faustino's main job is growing peanuts, which he was trained to do by the Nor Sud Intercultural Foundation. He is seeking a loan to purchase peanut seeds and agrochemicals, and to build a fence. With these investments, he will be able to continue his work and generate new earnings since this region is great for growing peanuts. He will also be able to improve his family's living conditions.

The "PRIMAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI" civil association will begin their fifth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamerica. They are made up of eight members and are led by a board of directors of which Irene is President. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied, and among the items sold are: sports clothing, cattle, mattresses, candies, clothing and cement.
The loan which they will take out will benefit small business owners, including Irene. She says she joined Pro Mujer four years ago, taking up the invitation of a promotion the institution was offering. Now she has a business selling cattle. She learned this from her mother, who worked in the same business, because she helped her as a child. As time passed she decided to set up business independently.
The loan which she will now take out will be to increase her capital (by buying sheep), which she will obtain from sellers at the Palcoco festival and then sell on to communities in the department of La Paz. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she is married with three children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care and training which the institution offers.

The “PROGRESO” communal group will begin its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Villa Tejada. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers of whom Lucia is the president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied and include: the sale of cattle, the sale of food, a neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, and the sale of candies.

The loan they are getting will benefit the small business owners, of whom Lucia is one. She says that six years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution that they had in her area. Currently, she has a business selling food, she states that she learned this business some years ago by her own initiative.

The loan she is now getting will be to increase her capital (purchase groceries in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and after preparation will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center that the institution offers.

The “LAS BULLANGUERAS” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the German Busch Focal Center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Fabiola is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling clothes for dogs, selling appliances, selling fruit, selling table cloths, selling food, selling tiles, selling jackets, and selling sports clothing.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, including Fabiola. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a promoter who is a part of the institution. Now she has a sewing and sports clothes business. She says that she learned this business from a sister in law several years ago.

The loan she will take out now will be to buy an overlock machine, which she will acquire from a fair in the city of El Alto. This purchase will benefit her for sewing more sports clothing to later sell in her locale. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health offered by the institution and the good treatment the promoter has for the clients.

The loan group Las Solidarias will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal German Busch. The group is comprised of 9 members and is directed by a board of which Verónica is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied and include: selling clothes, making and selling clothes, selling fruit, selling vegetables.
The loan they are requesting will benefit the micro-entrepreneurs, including Verónica. She says that this is her first time being a member of Pro Mujer and she joined on the invitation of an advisor for the organization. She currently has a business selling clothes. She let us know that she launched this business some years ago at her mother's suggestion, as her mother does the same. Later, she decided to launch her own business.
The loan that she is requesting now will be used to increase her work capital to buy clothes wholesale from the vendors in Oruro and, later, to sell the clothes in her store.
This form of work enables her to generate income to support her family economically, as she is single and has a son.
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health information and training that the institution offers.

Jorge is the father of 2 children. He is the owner of an adobe house and he also works as a mason. Jorge sells milk because he has a little farm, so he needs a loan to buy another milking cow, because he wants to increase his milk production.

Jorge is the only support of his family so he hopes you can help him.

Rogelio is 46 years old, married, and living in Aguada Ozamiz City. Rogelio is a hardworking father of one, and he works at a private company as a security guard. When not on duty, he operates transportation services in their village. His wife sells used clothing in their village. The couple earns well and they save money for the future education of their child. They are able to repair their house with Rogelio's generated revenue.

Recently, Rogelio borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy spare parts and do motor maintenance to replace the old and used ones.

Hopefully in the future, Rogelio can improve the general living situation of the entire family.

Romel is 31 years old, single, and lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Romel owns and operates a transportation transport service to earn a living. He has supported the family's daily needs with this income, in addition to working in a private company. After his work, he does transportation services to earn income.

Recently, he took a new loan of 30,000 to buy tires and repair his motorcycle to commute between his work and in other village in town.

His future plan is to buy another unit of motor for expansion of his business.

Juan is 48 years old and lives in his own house together with his husband.

He has been earning a living by growing basic crops and selling seashells for more than ten years. With what he is earning from his sales he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

He wants to improve his housing by cementing the floor and plaster the walls, but does not have enough capital to carry it out.

This is why he is requesting a loan to buy the necessary construction materials and to pay for labor to have a better house.

Ruth is 36 years old and married with two children. Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, bread, soap, and other snack foods.

Ruth has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ruth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Jose, 43, lives in his own house with his five children. He has been making trips in his pickup truck for more than a year; he has many customers who prefer him due to the responsibility he shows when driving. With what he obtains from his work he manages to cover his household expenses. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of tires and to do maintainence on his vehicle, since that is his only source of work and to be able to have a better quality of life.

Arben is 43 years old married with one child. He is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He earns an income from his transport service business. He started it almost ten years ago and he earns 10,000 PHP a month.

To improve his business, he is borrowing 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional accessories and tires. Before long, he is hopeful for the possibility of expanding his business.

Razia lives in Lahore. She is 39, married and the mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services locally. He is a loving and responsible father as well. Their children are school going. He is the sole earner in the family so he has to bear all the financial burden of the family. He works really hard to make ends meet.

Currently his rickshaw tires need to be replaced with new ones, as they have deteriorated due to constant driving. This has affected his income as well. He is short of money to buy new tires and for other repairs. Therefore Razia has requested a loan to help her husband through BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

Though they have low income, her husband is satisfied and content that he is capable of earning and is looking forward to more opportunities to raise more income. He plans to save money to buy a new rickshaw to rent out in the future.

The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josephine. She is fifty-two years old, married, and a mother of five children. She is a member of Muvakani Mbukilye S.h.g Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

Josephine does maize, bean, and poultry farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her farming, hence increase her income, which will enable her to pay for her children’s clothing, food, and school fees.

Josephine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

Doris is a humble, hardworking woman who has devoted much of her life to raising her children. She lives in the municipality of Envigado, where she performs spectacularly in the kitchen, since her business is a cafeteria. She sells her dishes mainly to neighbors in the area who are familiar with Doris's style and know they will always get delicious, very well-prepared food.

Doris would like to increase her food sales and work in a more comfortable way, so she is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients for her recipes such as chicken, flour, cheese and more. This loan will enable her to improve her business and obtain the income necessary to continue supporting her family, an opportunity provided by the Interactuar Corporation.

Luz started selling sausages some months ago. She learned this business activity thanks to a friend. She sought out this business activity as a way to generate money. As a vibrant and enterprising woman, she is looking for the sustenance of her household, which is comprised of her two children and her husband. This is because the cost of living is so high. Luz sees the need to generate more income.

That is the reason she needs financial support to help her improve the variety of products that she displays and sells to her customers and to other people by going door to door. She works alone every day for two hours.

She is requesting a loan to buy cured meats and sausages for her delicatessen. Her main dream is to be able to become the proprietor of a large business with a great variety of products. She knows that she is on a good path by working with the Interactuar corporation.

Josefa is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her four children. For over a year she has made a living making and selling stuffed tortillas. Her business is located close to her home in a busy area. With the sales she has been able to pay for some household expenses.

Josefa is requesting a loan to buy pork, fresh cheese, beans, corn, and other ingredients, so she can continue her work that generates good income.

Juan is just 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellin. He’s a young man who has big dreams, and one of them is to be independent and create his own business because he has always had an entrepreneur heart. Last year, he started a place where he sells food that he himself prepares. 

He started this business to help his family with the bills and because he loves what he does. He expects that his business will last for a long time and also wants to offer more food options to diversify what he prepares. He’s asking for a loan so that he can buy a roaster, a tent, and inputs like meat and bread. 

Juan dreams about buying a house where he can live with all his family so that he can thank them for everything they have done for him. Help this young man with big dreams to start accomplishing all; loan now.

Wendy needs a new loan to make the most of the holiday season. For this opportunity, she will buy, specifically, cosmetics and clothing items for both sexes so that she can make her business more competitive. She hopes to maintain her sales and earn more income.

Since she invested her last loan in a variety of catalog merchandise, her clientele has grown. She has more income and meets her obligations.

José is turning to Padecomsm again to ask for a new loan because of the service this institution gives him. He will invest in chopped hay, concentrate and vaccines to feed the cattle and sell them in robust health.

The previous loan gave him positive results to continue developing his farming and livestock activities. José says he is improving a lot in his business and financial situation. His family group is supported and he can give them a more comfortable lifestyle.

Orlandine, 29 years old, is separated. He lives in his own house, made of rustic material, with his son in the district of Cañaris, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. The inhabitants of this place work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with 10 years of experience in the field. The loan that will be granted to him will be used in agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizers and paying labor costs for his harvest. In this way, it will help him with the physiological, morphological and productive improvement of his crop, and also to have a good harvest, and in the end he will have greater production and a better quality product, so he won't have problems selling his product.

Orlandine is a new borrower for Edpyme Alternativa. He signs with a guarantee.

Carlos is opting to take out a new loan to buy cattle to raise and fatten and later sell at a better price to his customers. In this way, he hopes to have better income to get ahead with his family and pay ff the new loan.

Using loans has led to his business have better production of basic grains and sales have increased. He feels satisfied because he has given his family more well being, and that continues. He also remarks that he hasn't faced problems to keep working.

Mamisa is 42 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Senaki district. Mamisa is unemployed at the moment. Each family member gets a pension from the government as they are refugees. Mamisa's husband serves locals as a taxi driver and tries to cover the expenses of the five family members.

Mamisa wants to start a trading business as there is high unemployment rate in the region. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,700 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes to resell.

Mamisa is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

In the municipality of San Pedro Jocopilas, located in the rural outskirts of Quiché, the “Monte de Sión” trust bank, of nine organized women, has its home here.

Agustina, with 42 years of age and a positive spirit, has never been to school, but that hasn’t prevented her from being president of her trust bank. She runs a successful tailoring business, making traditional aprons and blouses, and in addition, manages a small convenience store. Agustina plans to use a large portion of her microloan to restock her store inventory with products such as sugar, salt, pasta, coffee, eggs, beans, juice, and soda, and will use the remainder of the loan to buy typical cloth to make aprons and blouses, quality thread to embroider traditional belts, and three pigs to fatten up, an investment that will bring some extra income to her and her family. Thanks to the increased profit in her businesses, this proud mother has been able to provide education to her five children.

“Monte de Sión,” or “Mount Zion” trust bank, is beginning its first micro-credit experience, and they are ready and excited. Motivated by the importance of their development as women, these ladies have various business, including tortillerías, convenience stores, animal husbandry businesses, tailoring shops creating and selling traditional clothing, bags, and cloth, and corn mills.

With a smile, Agustina says, “Thank you, Kiva, for providing us with opportunities to move up with loans that help us make the most of our small businesses.”

Santa Clara La Laguna is a small town located above the beautiful Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is located in the Department of Solola, an area with rich Maya K’iche traditions and a thriving economy. In the town, nine women have organized themselves into the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Pascua” with the goals of expanding their small businesses, making progress in their lives and creating additional income.

Alicia is 32 years old, married, has one son, and is a member of the Trust Bank. She was pleased to share information about her life. She studied until the 6th grade and has several businesses. She has a traditional clothing business and sells elaborate blouses called “huipiles,” and woven skirts called “cortes" (both used and new). She sells both in town and in neighboring ones. She also raises chickens and sells them. Finally, to create a little more income, she sells bread.

Alicia is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders that she will use to buy more traditional clothing to sell, and to buy two dozen chickens. Her greatest hope, like mothers everywhere in the world, is that her only son, who is 16 years old, will continue his studies through high school and perhaps attend the university! He is currently in his second year of high school.

Each month, the women of the Trust Bank gather together for their monthly meeting. These meetings give the ladies an opportunity to share information and support each other.

Alicia and her friends in the “Flor de Pascua” Trust Bank share that they feel fortunate that Kiva lenders from all parts of the world are learning about them. They are grateful for the loans that will help expand their businesses, increase sales and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families! Thank you!

Pablo lives and works in the community of Cumandayti in the Villa Vaca Guzmán municipality in the department of Chuquisaca. From a very young age he has worked in agriculture and livestock and it is the only source of income he has at the moment. He has a son who is dependent on the family unit. 

Pablo needs financial support to begin beekeeping (honey production). He already knows what he needs to start this work thanks to the training he received through the NGO Fundación Pasos. At the moment Pablo lives at home together with his family. 

The loan that Pablo needs will be used to implement his apiculture production to produce honey. With this new line of work he will be able to have a better income in the future and because of this he and his family will be able to live in better conditions.

The members belong to the Los Lideres De San Lorenzo (The Leaders of San Lorenzo) communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Ocobamba in the La Convención province in the department of Cusco.

Walter is one of the communal bank members. He is a hardworking person who works as a farmer and also raises small animals to sell. He is 36 years old and has two children who he is responsible for. This is why he would like to increase his production to have more income and at the same time a better quality of life. He is applying for a loan to buy fertiliser and seeds.

The other members work in businesses such as a grocery store, raising animals, agriculture and a restaurant. They are grateful to the Kiva lenders who continue to trust in them and they promise to make their repayments on time.

Mr Josin is an active, responsible and enterprising person who wants to start a business in installation of household electrics. This is because it is a great opportunity and there is a lack of an electrician in the municipality who is able to install electrics in homes. 

Because of this, Mr Josin took a course in CEA THAQU THAQU, which is the center of alternative education that provides training in 'Household Electricity' and other technical topics. FAUTAPO and CEA THAQU THAQU are institutions that support productive entrepreneurs in the Mizque region. 

Josin currently works as a taxi driver and with his vehicle is affiliated with a Union. To improve his income he decided to start a new career and thus be able to offer a better life to his family. He will do this by performing electrical installations.

Mr Josin says that to be well prepared, he needs tools such as a ladder, drill, screwdriver and helmet, among other items. This initiative is Josin's, and he is very excited about the project.

Señor Francisco is 30 years old. He currently lives in his home and works a communal plot of land.

He has a wife, and with her he has two dependent children who attend their local elementary school. He lives in the department of Chuquisaca, in Luis Calvo province, in the municipality of Muyupampa.

This loan requester's main activity is peanut production, and he has training from the Fundación Intercultural NOR SUR. This is why he is needs the loan, which will be used for the purchase of peanut seeds, agricultural chemicals, and to prepare the soil.

By purchasing these things he will invest in his business and he will be able to generate new income, since this activity produces a good yield in his area. His living conditions, along with his wife's and their children's, will improve, both at home and in their daily life.

Zulfiya, 55, is from Vakhsh. She has two children, 10 and 15 years old. For over 10 years she has been earning a living from livestock breeding. She buys livestock for fattening up and sells it at the market within 40 days. Her children help her with her business. She decided to increase her livestock count and needs a certain sum of money to buy additional livestock. She believes that you will be able to help her.

The economy of Junin Canton is based around agriculture and commerce. In Junin, the purest form of aguardiente from sugarcane is made, famous for its high alcohol content and known as a drink “only for men.” The gastronomy is known for traditional roasted pig head, a plate enjoyed by locals and visitors.

Mr. Washington lives in this area. He is 49 years old, married, and has had two children from this relationship, a 20-year-old and a 16-year-old. The older is independent and the younger studies in college. His spouse is a housewife.

Washington makes a living raising pigs and poultry. He has a small farm in his house. During the seasons, he buys many chickens and raises them for two or three months, the time it takes for them to be ready to sell. Afterwards, he takes them to some shops in the locality or sells them by the pound around his house or to merchants who come to his house. On the other hand, he slaughters the pigs and then sells the meat by the pound. He has spent several years at this business and it’s been going pretty well. This is also thanks to the good flavor of his wife’s “bollos” (dough from grated green banana with peanut, wrapped in banana leaves. They can have fish or pork in them), which she sells on the weekends, traveling the route Pueblo Nuevo – Calderón from 6:00 am to 10:00 am.

This new loan is going to be used to buy pigs, food, and medicine for chickens and pigs. It is his second loan, and he likes the foundation because the interest is low. His dream is to have a pig farm.

Omar is 28 years old, married, and studied into primary school. He is a farmer and livestock raiser, who resides with his wife and their children.

Both Omar and his wife are dedicated to agriculture. They work all morning, then his wife does the domestic chores and, later, helps care for the livestock. This is, in part, because afternoons, Omar works on a ranch.

Omar needs this loan to purchase a cow which will help them, in the future, to increase milk production for sale, in order to obtain added income.

Omar dreams of being able to buy more livestock and beginning a small business to make and sell milk products.

Rose is a 43 year old farmer. She is an extraordinary woman with a great personality. At a time when many farmers in Kenya are abandoning dairy farming and agriculture owing to poor yield and low income, Rose, hailing from Chuka, is scripting a success story with her dairy farming. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver.

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows.

Rose is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy unit will provide a good place where cows can relax and also they will not be affected with harsh weather conditions. Through the loan her cows will produce more milk and they will never suffer from diseases that are brought about by harsh weather conditions. Rose believes that if women smallholder farmers had the same access to finance the number of people who sleep on hungry stomachs could be reduced in Kenya..

Wilmer, a single man, currenly lives with his mother, and works raising cattle and pigs, in addition to growing basic grains.

The agricultural jobs are done every winter, and he learned this work thanks to his father. However, after his father passed away, [the works] have been done with the help of his brothers, who have taken on the works on their own.

Wilmer is asking for a loan to invest in paying for the collection of the harvest and to purcharse more pigs, so that he can increase his inventory. With this investment, Wilmer will have more income that will enable him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Wilmer's dream is to obtain good profit levels that will give a better quality of life to his family.

Dorcas is a hardworking, dedicated and honest 41-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and three children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift valley region of Kenya.

For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crop selling. Dorcas passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available because of having a poorly built dairy unit. She also has poor productivity in her farm.

She is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit and to buy farm inputs. Through the loan she will buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds. Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income.

With the loan, Dorcas will be able to build a modern dairy unit, which will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Dorcas will achieve this.

An increase in income will allow Dorcas to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Dorcas fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Dorcas to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

Anarkan successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and all who helped her with the financing.

Anarkan currently has four cows, one horse and ten sheep on her farm. She grows clover and sugar beets for selling on 4.02 hectares of land. She sells milk every day. The monthly income from the business is around 37,000 som (KGS).

Anarkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She intends to spend the income from the loan on building a house.

Syyada is 46 years old, married and has two daughters and two sons. She has secondary education and works as a nurse at the rural hospital. As an additional income for her family, she and her husband work with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started in 1995 with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistent work, Syyada currently has one horse, eight cows and 50 sheep. She grows sweet corn for selling on 0.32 hectares of own land.

With an aim to further develop her business, Syyada turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 140,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and sheep to fatten and resell. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

Madat is 30 years old and a refugee. He is living in the refugee settlement called Bilasuvar is south part of the country. He resides with his family, his father and mother. Madat has a college education and uses this knowledge in the daily farming activities. He has studied agricultural subjects. To provide good income for his family, he is involved in agriculture.

Madat started his business 8 years ago and has good experience in it. He has 6 cows and 14 sheep. He raises calves, fattens them and then takes their meat to the local bazaar. He keeps these animals on his own land. There is a big demand for meat in Azerbaijan. People consume a lot of meat. Most of the traditional dishes like kebabs, kufta and rice consist of meat.

Madat has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale. Madat intends to channel his earnings toward developing his business. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him.

As a married parent of eight children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Jovita is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Maria is a divorced woman who needs a loan to fix her kitchen and bathroom because she wants to rent out the place where she is living in order to have more money.

Maria is still an artisan but her business is not as good as she would like, so she wants to make a good investment by fixing up her house.

She hopes you can trust her. She is healthy and is good with money. In the picture, she is in the bathroom that will be fixed up.

Elias David is 48 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. He has a son who helps him a lot in his work to provide for the family, so he feels very proud of him. Two years ago he started a stationery store where he sells a great amount of products, something he learned from his brother in law.

The inputs can be really expensive and he wants to invest in his business, but right now he doesn’t have the money to do this. He expects that the investment will help him improve the conditions of the stationery store and make it sustainable. He’s asking for a loan so he can make some adjustments to the stationery store, and to pay for a work force. 

David also wants to improve his house, something he hopes the business will allow him to do. Help David now with the loan he needs.

Monica Isabel is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. She has two daughters who are 11 and nine years of age, and who are the reason for this woman's life. She goes to work every day so she can provide for them. She has had a business since 2010, something she started because she loves to serve people. She has a food selling place.

She wants to improve her business by increasing her sales, clients and profits, so she can better provide for her family and give her daughters a good quality of life. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy a big display case and invest in inventory so she has more to offer.

Monica Isabel dreams of improving her house, and the most important thing, paying for her children's education so they become professionals. Help her now to accomplish all her dreams with a loan.

Valentin is 41-years old. He is divorced and lives in his own rustic home. He lives with his youngest son in the district of Cañaris, Ferreñafe province and department of Lambayeque in Peru. He has many good personal and work references from the people in the area. The people who live here work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 10 years of experience doing this work. The loan given will be used in agricultural jobs, application and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers and labor for his crops. This will help with the physiological, morphological and productivity improvement of his crops, as well as having a timely harvest and a better production and a better quality product. This way he will not have problems selling his product.

Valentin is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has worked with two loans. Last season he was loaned 1,500 Soles which he paid back punctually.

Rael is 42 years old, married to Paul and blessed with five children aged between 18 and four years old. She has been in the milk and tea selling business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to pay fees, buy more milk and tea for resale in the village and she anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to educate her children to the university level.

Robert is 39 years old, and has been operating a butcher shop for three years now. He is very hardworking, and he is doing well in his business.

Robert desires to have branches of the same business in various areas, but is limited by capital and seasonality changes. At this point, he requesting a loan to buy more cows for slaughtering and to sell as meat on Christmas eve.

Abey is 45 years old, married with children who are all attending school. He has a responsibility of paying their school fees.

He has done farming for now 20 years. He started with small scale farming, but now does it on a larger scale.

He is doing well, but is interrupted by pests, being a rainy season. He is requesting a loan facility to buy pesticides and spray his crops for better yields.

Henry is 24-years-old, single, and lives with his mother, who he helps economically. He is a responsible and very dedicated person. 

Henry has worked since he was very young in the raising and sale of chicken. This occupation is his only economic support. He requests the credit to invest in more chicks, to increase his income and therefore help his mother.

Idelso, 40-years-old and single, lives in his parents' house, in the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca, country of Peru. He has many good references, as many personal as professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this locality mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He works in the breeding and sale of pigs and other smaller animals, with experience in the industry since he was 3-years-old. He requests the loan for the purchase of more animals like pigs, ducks, turkeys, etc. In this manner, he can increase his income and therefore have better life conditions. He has experience in the business.

Idelso is a recurring partner for Edpyme Alternativa.

Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Riaz to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Riaz is a 46 years old married woman and the mother of 6 children. In order to support her husband( also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk and owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

Fadayel, 44, lived alone with no income for many years after her parents died. That made ‎her go live with her brother, who works but earns a low income. He has a wife and children, and that means he cannot ‎help Fadayel or cover her daily expenses.‎

Fadayel is ambitious and wants to be productive. Therefore, she decided to start her own business. She ‎began her business with a low quantity of household supplies and she sold the products from her brother's house, where ‎she lives.

She has since decided to expand her business and has rented a shop. Now she needs to stock her shop ‎with a large quantity of products. She has applied for a loan to buy household and kitchen supplies, such ‎as dishes, laundry baskets, trays, cups and jars. Fadayel needs your support. ‎

One of the two mebers of the Duo Yolanda Esta is Yolanda, 44, who sells clothing for women, men and children in San Bartolome. She is asking for a loan to buy clothing and cosmetics to stock her store for the Christmas season. She wants to meet her customers' demands and their tastes. She hopes that she can take advantage of the holiday season to earn more money.

Santos is 45 years old. He lives in a house he owns, with his wife and three children. He has worked growing vegetables for more than 30 years. With the profit he maks he is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He wants to improve his home by constructing an additional room in the place shown in the photograph. Since he lacks sufficient capital, he is seeking a loan to buy all the necessary construction materials in order to have a larger, more comfortable home.

The best sweets are made in the Rocafuerte canton, and they prepare more than 300 varieties. The most sought after are the coconut, guava, banana, fig, sweet potato, and eggnog flavors, and there are many other delicacies that have crossed the borders of Manabí and the country.

Señor Isauro lives in this area. He is 32 years old and lives in a free union relationship from which he has two children, ages 6 and 2. The older one is in school. His partner is a housewife. They live in their own house.

Isauro works in agriculture. He plants corn, beans, cilantro, and cucumbers, among other short season crops (two to three months to give production). He also has lemon trees which he harvests twice a month. The weekends are when he takes the products to market to be sold directly to the wholesalers in the market. It is when more people arrive at the market and his sales are better. The rest of the week he works with his crops.

He is going to use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for day workers. He likes the loans from the foundation because they are quick and have a low interest rate. His dream is to have a large farm to be able to be the best grower in the zone.

Leonides, at the age of 49 and married, lives in his own house made of rustic materials. He lives with his wife in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén and the department of Cajamarca, Peru, in a rural zone. He has very good personal as well as work references from the residents of the zone. The majority of the inhabitants of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising.

He works raising and selling goats. He makes his purchases in the neighboring hamlets as well as in his own. In addition he sells poultry such as hens and ducks and raises and sells cacao. He has more than 15 years of experience in this work.

The destiny of the loan will be to invest in his business by stocking it with a greater quantity of animals, with which he will generate greater income and thus be able to improve his quality of life. For this work there is no bigger competition in the zone, and with [his work] he obtains better prices.

Leonides is a repeat client with Edpyme Alternative. He will sign with his wife.

Isaac is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children.

He has had a transportation business for 5 years. He will be using the loan to purchase clothes to resell during the festive Christmas season.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to provide for his family and educate his children well.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a comfortable life.

Sadaqat is 45 years old and married. She is running a business selling garments to provide for her family. She purchases a variety of children's garments from the market at low prices and then sells them to the people of her community.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

The garment sales business has allowed Nusrat to help earn money for the household, thus easing the burden of expenses and improving the standard of living for the family. For the improvement of her business, Sadaqat  has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a winter collection of garments to meet customers’ demands consistently, in order to increase her net income and improve their standard of living.

The "Ngaakom" Group is starting its first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They meet in the Teshie branch office. The group has 6 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Regina is the President. The members of this group are developing a variety of businesses, including: kenkey sales, smoked fish sales, toothbrush and toothpaste sales, general goods sales and soap sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesswomen in this group. Regina states that this is the fourth time that she has worked with ID-Ghana. She joined the group at the invitation of one of the loan officers from the institution who works in her area. Regina now has a business selling kenkey and fried fish. She got to know this business because she learned it from her mother a number of years ago.

This loan will help Regina to increase her capital (to buy maize, fish, firewood and other ingredients at wholesale prices). She will purchase this inventory from the wholesale suppliers in the city of Teshie, and she will later sell the products from her sales stall. By working in this way, Regina can generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married with three children all completing their schooling.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the training and health services that the institution offers.

Jean Claude is 29 years old and he is married with two children. Jean is seen in the picture holding a pink file. He is a farmer and cultivates potatoes, beans, tomatoes and bananas. He takes his produce to the market and sells them to his customers.

Jean was elected president of his group, Muyange, due to his commitment. Through Vision Finance Company, he is requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy more fertilizers so that he can get better growth. He would like to increase his harvest, thus sell more and earn more income. One of the challenges Jean faces is that sometimes the produce from his farm is not enough to provide a profit after the sale.
