Thanks to his years of experience and what his father taught him since he was a boy, he has full capacity to work and to advise other farmers in the area on these matters who need help with their production.

The loan he is requesting is to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, plantain seeds and pesticides. In this way he will inject capital into his business and improve his crops in a significant manner facing the biggest difficulty he has which is the changing climate and it's effect on his crops.

He has great faith in his business and great hope in the supportive people who help the working farmers of Colombia as the Corporación Interactuar does.

Support a humble farmer with a loan so he can get ahead with his land!

Nelby is a hardworking and humble farmer. She is 39 years old and continues working to meet her family's basic expenses. She is married and has three children.

She has worked raising and selling pigs and young cattle for 12 years. She learned this work from her family and it has allowed her to generate income to move forward.

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase pigs, materials to repair her corrals, and feed for the animals, so that she can have better production, which will allow her to generate more profits when she makes a sale.

Nelby says that problems are not an impediment to continuing to do the work you are passionate about and has fed you throughout your life. She continues fighting without rest to successfully fatten her pigs and cattle so she can improve her family's quality of life and offer her young children the opportunity of having an excellent quality education so they can become upstanding, successful professionals.

Yolber is 34 years old and lives with his four children and common-law wife. He currently works raising fish, and has space available on the farm where he lives and works for them.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cachama fish, and to care for and feed them so he will be able to increase his production and move into a wider market. This will allow him to improve his family's income to meet all of the household necessities.

Yolber says that his main goal is to watch over his family's well-being, be self-sustaining, and generate more profit from his business so he can give his family a better quality of life.

Sandra is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pedro de Uraba. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and started a sales business five years ago to help her boyfriend and father of her children to provide for their family. She started this business with the help of her mother in law. Sandra has a lot of dreams regarding her business, including opening a store, creating new jobs and having a big selection of items for customers to buy. She’s aware of the need to invest in the business so it can get better, and wants to increase her clients and profits, which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy clothes, shoes, bed sheets and other items to sell during this Christmas season.  Her goal for the future is to save enough money for her children to have a good education so they can succeed.

Elba is 49 years old and married, her husband works in agriculture and she has a daughter who woks in the pig trade.

Elba has worked in agriculture for the past 10 years, specifically growing corn, beans, and coffee, all of which she learned from her mother, who worked in agriculture her whole life. She travels by foot and walks 30 minutes to work. 

She also has a mill in her home to help make some extra money and cover the needs of her family.

Elba needs the loan to buy cattle and fertilizer. She dreams of having a small cattle breeding business and to produce dairy to sell in her community.

Petronila is a single mother, providing for five children. She has several business activities, mainly raising and selling cattle and pigs. She also butchers these kinds of animals. She launched her business ten years ago with her own money, she works from seven in the morning until five in the evening.

To improve her business she is asking for help with a loan, which she will use to buy cattle and pigs. She will raise them, fatten them and then sell them at a wholesale discount. She hopes to recoup the investment in a short time to quickly pay back the loan.

Her dream is to have a business that is well-known in the area, and offer her customers a better future.

Javier is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been raising animals and selling his products around the zone where he lives for the last 20 years.

In addition to this he also works as a transportation driver. 

He is requesting another loan to buy another cow and continue his work, since it is already working well for him and this way he can earn a better income.

Khouloud is a 31-year-old make up artist from Chouf, Lebanon. She is married and living with her husband and two children who both attend school.

Since she was a teenager, Khouloud enjoyed creating new looks using make up on her family and friends. In 2011, she decided to turn her hobby into a business by opening a small beauty salon inside her house. She provides her clients with all types of beauty related services such as hairdressing, make up, manicures and pedicures.

Khouloud's clients see her as a very hard working and professional woman. She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to buy a new set of equipment for hair dressing and make up.

The loan will allow Khouloud to work in better conditions by replacing her old equipment with a more efficient ones.

Her husband works as a security officer and earns a limited income. Therefore, Khouloud's business allows the family to increase the household's income

38-year old Angela is hardworking, dedicated to her family, and a dreamer. Ever since she was a small child, her greatest wish was to be a small businesswoman. With a lot of effort and discipline she has achieved her goal.

Today Angela runs a food cart. She starts work at 7 am and finishes at 8 pm daily. She sells all kinds of fried food, pastries, and drinks. Her hope is for her business to become known throughout the district as one of the best places to eat.

In order to succeed in this goal, Angela is now seeking a loan to buy ingredients and expand the range of food she offers so she can meet current demands. She hopes to improve her financial situation and her family's standard of living.

Being the only vendor of products for the home is a great advantage for moving her business forward, and it is a platform for Eloina to prosper and be motivated to triumph in her business venture and in the difficult market.

Her principal difficulty is the lack of capital to buy merchandise, and for this reason she wants to apply for a loan to buy products for the home, such as plates and cooking utensils, among other items, and in this way motivate the use of these products among her acquaintances and people of the neighborhood.

Her principal dream is to have a stable business and a commercial location, to improve sales, and to have this business give her economic stability and sufficient [income] to cover the needs of her family.

Jose is the father of two beautiful and adorable little girls whom he loves with all his heart.

He is a salesman, a job he started because he likes being independent. He realised this when he was a student and used to sell items to his friends. He learned how to do this without input from anyone else.

Jose works ten hours daily. He is seeking a loan to buy more stock: cosmetics and personal healthcare items. Then he will be able to better stock his business and have more inventory. His goals in life centre on his daughters; he wishes to give them a better standard of living and pay for their education.

Jose is a simple countryman aged 27. He comes from a very hardworking family who works the land to earn their living. Thanks to the knowledge they have passed on to him, Jose today raises and sells pigs. He starts work in the early hours of the morning caring for and feeding the animals. He sells them either by the pound or the whole animal depending on his customers' requirements, most of whom own farms in the area. In this way Jose earns his living and supports his family.

He is known as a successful man who is active and hardworking. Because he wishes to continue to thrive, he is seeking a loan to buy two suckling pigs to raise and fatten in his corral which has room available. He plans to build a new pigsty. This will help Jose increase production and serve to satisfy the growing demand for pork in the upcoming season. He will make more sales and thus improve his family's financial situation.

Jose wishes to continue working hard and making an effort every day. He wishes to carry on with his role as breadwinner for the household, watching over the wellbeing of his wife, and enjoying with her a better standard of living.

Cristobal, at the age of 23, lives in a free union relationship and is the father of two children.

He now works in raising and selling pigs, since he has space available on a small farm, and he takes advantage of the fact that he has knowledge in this work thanks to his family, which for all his life has done agricultural work.

His perseverance, effort, and will to get ahead motivate him to apply for the support of the loan, with which he will buy more piglets to raise and fatten. In this way he will be able to continue with his profitable project, with which he hopes to obtain good results, especially in the season at the end of the year, in which the consumption of this meat increases, which for him means generating more income.

Cristobal wants to work hard to advance his project, and in the future he dreams of paying for the education of his children, having a sustainable business with a diversity of products to offer to the market, and being able to guarantee a better well-being and quality of life for his family.

Lina is 35 years old and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Medellin. Since she was a little girl, she always hoped to have her own business and a family to provide for, and now she has both. She operates a general store, which she has been doing for three years. 

Lina works a lot in her store, not only to give to her family a good quality of life, but because she loves what she does and wants to see her store as a successful and recognized one. She wants to improve her sales and to increase the profits. Lina requested a loan, which she will use to buy some showcases and general stock items. 

Lina wants the best for her children and hopes to pay for a good education for all of them; she also would like to improve her house.

Alejandra is a 23 year old woman. She is single, without children, and her business is selling second hand clothing. She is happy, joyful and hard working. She works in the "Max Paredes" zone, characterized for grouping the largest manufacturing producers and commerce in all areas. With a cold a dry climate with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Centigrades. Alejandra is dark complected, of short stature and wears thick lens glasses. Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home with her family and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and at work. She lives with her parets who also work. They live in a rented room, built out of brick with corrugated metal roofing and wood floors. They have running water, electricity and sewage. Her business is selling women's second hand clothing, she buys cloths wholesale to sort and choose women's clothing. She then sells them and displays them on mannequins and hangers in her outdoor sales stand. "I starte the business with my sister, until I had enough capital to become independent..." she states. Her business is successful because she cleans and displays the clothing in an attractive manner. Th advantage of her business is that she sells her clothing by gender, the disadvantage is the lack of merchandise during the Christmas season. Her ream is to develop her business until it becomes more stable. She wants to buy furniture and mannequins for her business. This is the first loan with the institution in one year of activity. This is why Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy furniture and mannequins to sell clothes second hand.

Amal, a 35-year-old, Lebanese woman, started her clothes-selling business in Beirut back in 2010 in order to help her husband cover the children's school tuition fees. Her husband owns a shop that sells all types of curtains and her three children all go to school.

In her home-based shop, Amal sells clothes for women and children. She also sells perfume and accessories. This variety of products allows her to attract women and children in a very strategic location in Beirut.

Amal needs a loan to be able to meet the demands of her clients. She is asking for an LBP 2,571,003 (Lebanese pounds) loan for the first time, from Kiva partner, Ibdaa Microfinance SAL. She will be using the loan to buy new clothes and accessories her clients are asking for.

Amal is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her sales and income from her business. With this improved income, she will be supporting her husband in providing their three children with good living conditions.

Mohammad was born in 1976. He is single and lives with his family in Irbid. He has been running his own grocery for ‎many years now. He started his project selling a few vegetables and food supplies.

Now, Mohammad wants to expand his ‎business and increase his profit to be able to cover his parents’ expenses and to provide for them. Unfortunately, he currently ‎doesn't have enough money to do so.

For this reason, Mohammad has applied for this loan to buy more products and food supplies ‎such as flour, chips, soft drinks, candies, and vegetables to improve his shop and thus also his standard of living.‎

Edwin is 41 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. Edwin has been providing transportation services in his car for 15 years. He has many customers, who prefer his services because he is a responsible driver. Edwin is able to cover household costs with the income from his work. Edwin is applying for a loan in order to buy tyres and look after his vehicle. He needs to do this as the car is his only source of income. By looking after the vehicle and working, Edwin can enjoy a higher quality of life.

Ever is a 38-year-old man who lives with his life partner and has a 16-year-old daughter. His business is selling and installing satellite dishes.
He is consistent, responsible, and hardworking. 

His business is located in the 'Max Paredes' district, characterized as being one of the oldest and most popular shopping areas. Here, clothes are made next to restaurants, and schools, and businesses of all types. The weather is cold and dry with a maximum temperature of 14 degrees Celsius.

Ever is swarthy, with short black hair and a sturdy build. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks within his family. He speaks Spanish in situations of general culture and in his business. He shares his life with his partner, who also works in the same business, and with his daughter who is going to school. They live in a rented space built of brick with a corrugated metal roof, and that is connected to potable water, electric power, and a sewage system. 

His business is selling and installing satellite dishes. The long distances and difficult access to remote towns makes television a nonexistent service. To alleviate this situation, a good solution is to install a satellite dish, which provides a coded signal to be reproduced on the TV. "Most of the rural areas and neighborhoods located far from the city center do not have access to cable television. I offer them an alternative solution to stay on par with the rest of the population..." he says. 

His business is a success thanks to the fact that his customers live in rural and distant areas without access to television. The advantage of his business is that he takes care of sales and installation; the disadvantage is the lack of antennas and decoders to provide the service. 

His dream is to expand his sales in rural areas. He wants to buy antennas and decoders so he can set up satellite television connections in the country. 

This is his first loan sequence with our institution in three years of operating this business. It is for these reasons that Ever is requesting a loan to buy antennas and decoders to connect satellite television in the country.

Ever is 30 years old. He has owned a chicken farm for some years, and it brings him customers who request his products. He lives in his own house with his two daughters, one who is 9 years old and the other who is 9 months old. Ever wants to invest in a greater quantity of chickens to meet the demands of his customers during the Christmas season. He is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, feed, and vitamins in order to fulfill the orders during the Christmas season.

Nidal is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Nidal has a stall in the city where he sells shoes and clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Nidal is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually let him save enough income to expand his business.

Muhammad is a 24-year-old, single man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Muhammad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Muhammad is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually permit him to save enough income to expand his business.

Alaa' is a 29-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Alaa' has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Alaa' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually to save enough income to expand his business.

Dalal is a 46-year-old married mother of two. Seven years ago, she started managing her husband's grocery shop so that he can focus on his scraps business. They are working hard to cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Dalal is trying desperately to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season.

Dalal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Manal is a 39-year-old housewife. She is responsible for her kid`s education. To be able to do so, she had to find a source of ‎income in addition to her husband`s income. So Manal started her own business and opened a beauty salon in her home. After she succeeded in that business and had regular customers, she opened an independent beauty salon. ‎Now she is applying for a loan in order to buy a new hair dryer, new tools for nails and new makeup to increase her quality ‎of work and increase her income so she will be able to help her husband more and more.‎

Enadis is a very hardworking person who through her efforts has managed to get her four children ahead by offering them a good quality education. She is a single mother. She has been selling clothing and shoes for a long time, and with great effort has overcome many obstacles in her way.

Currently Enadis has very good orders from her customers, and since she has not got much capital she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale in response to the large number of orders from her customers. 

She spends ten hours a day at her business. Her biggest dream is for her business to get ahead, and this way she will be able to offer her children a good quality of life and greater financial stability. She knows that hand in hand with Interactuar she will be able to accomplish this.

Elizabeth is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. She has two children, one son and one daughter, and they are the most important thing in her life. Some years ago she studied how to sew and after that she started her own business sewing clothes, something that has allowed her to provide for her children. Now she wants to take her business to the next level.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some fabric, paints and inputs for making clothes, so with this she can increase production. She expects that the investment she´s about to make will improve her sales, will help her to be more competitive and will make her business last a long time. She dreams about paying for the best education for her children.

Elizabeth dreams big, and you can help her to accomplish it all. Loan now!

John is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of La Ceja. He has two sons who are the motor of his life, and they were the ones who pushed him to start his own business five years ago, raising cattle. Now his sons are men and he needs to pay for their professional study, which is the reason why he wants to improve his business.

He’s asking for a loan that lets him buy a milk cow. He’s convinced that with this new cow he will increase his clients and sales, and with those, the profits will improve too. He dreams of paying for his children's education and buying his own house where they all can have a good life.

Help John with the loan he needs and watch him accomplish great things.

Safaa is a 40-year-old married mother of three. In 2003 she decided to establish her own perfume sales business to support her husband, who's working abroad to provide his family with the necessities of life.

Safaa is a hard working businesswoman who is putting forth a great effort to develop her business through increasing its capital with diversified products that attract customers' attention and increase her sales.

Safaa is developing her business properly, but sometimes she needs external financial support to buy certain occasional items she is not ready for. That's why, and since the Holy Christmas season is soon, Safaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Christmas gifts and newly released cosmetics.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business as much as she can in a well-managed way.

Josephine, who is in her early 60s, is a widow with two adult daughters. For ten years now, she has been selling cold drinks at wholesale prices. Josephine works from ten in the morning through four in the afternoon and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She successfully repaid a previous loan that she used to increase her stock of drinks. Josephine used the profit from her first loan to take care of her family, repay her loan, and cover household expenses.

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy and sell drinks at retail and wholesale prices. This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Josephine is part of a loan group called Tabata Shule, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loan. Josephine appreciates Kiva’s support for their group. In the future, she dreams of owning a poultry business.

Mahmoud is a 22-year-old, single man from Dier Al-Balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Mahmoud has a stall for selling kitchenware in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mahmoud has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of kitchenware to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually allow him to save enough income to expand his business.

Yaser is a 35-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. 

Yaser has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. 

Yaser took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

Ahmad is a 29-year-old, married man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Ahmad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Ahmad is taking a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to not only increase his sales and customers but also let him eventually save enough income to expand his business.

Hamza is a 28-year-old married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

He has a store for selling laptops and computers in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Hamza took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of laptops to sell at his store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

Ana continues in her business selling used clothing (she is standing second from the right in a pink blouse). She used the loan she obtained previously to buy packs of used clothing. Her loan payments were on time as a result of the good sales volume she had.

Currently the community bank continues working together. The members have bought raw materials for their businesses, paid for services and improved their infrastructures.

Ana's business improved because she was able to increase her working capital, "I improved my capital and in that period sales were also better so I could continue expanding..." she says. Her business is successful because she goes out every day to look for customers in different places.

The advantage of her business is that she has a variety of merchandise. The disadvantage is the lack of goods to improve business. Her dream is to open a clothing store. She wants to buy used clothing wholesale. This is her second loan through the institution in the six years she has been involved in this activity.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy used clothing wholesale to improve her working capital.

Ingris is 30 years and lives in the municipality of Planeta Rica. She has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls between 14 and 7 years of age. It has been a complete challenge to raise her children, but she loves being a mother and feels proud of them.

Last year she started her own business, selling clothes. Her mother was the one who taught everything about this business, and she’s really grateful with her.

She wants to improve her sales and increase her clients, so she wants to stock up. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some stock like jeans, blouses and t-shirts to increase her products to sell.

Ingris is a mother who wants to see her children become great people, and wants them to be good members of the community, that’s why she dreams with paying for the best education for them. Help her to accomplish that and more with just a loan.

Alberto is 46 years old and is a married man. He lives with his wife in the municipality of Sahagun. He has four children whom he loves very much and who have become the reason why he wakes up every day to work hard to provide for his family. In 2011 he started raising chickens so he could give to his family a better life.

He’s asking for a loan so he can buy more chickens, plus some food and vitamins for them. There´s a lot of competition in the market and the inputs can be a little expensive, that’s why he asked for the loan, something he believes will help him to be more competitive and make the business last over time.

He dreams of buying a house for his family.

Help Alberto to fulfill his goals; a loan will do that for him.

Nelson is a humble and hard-working farmer with the drive and willpower that characterizes men and women in the countryside. He is a man with an entrepreneurial mind. From a very young age he learned all of the tasks of the country such as farming and raising animals, so much so that today he has his own coffee cultivation. He also sells food in the market in the plaza of the town of Santa Fe de Antioquia.

This person has as a goal to increase and improve the crops that he currently has, and it is for that reason that he has requested the help from a Corporación Interactuar (Kiva Field Partner) loan. He will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, and to purchase coffee seeds.

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as an businessman and as a person, as well as increase his earnings and continue providing for his household. 

He only wants is to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

Leidy is a 24 year old woman who is asking for a loan to buy a selection of men's and women's clothing. She wants to take advantage of the end of the year season which is very soon.

She is an independent young woman who decided to generate her own work opportunities by starting a business. Now she hopes to be successful. With her business, her life plan is to buy a house, go to school, and have a family. That is why with the loan for clothing inventory, she is seeking to generate more sales to be financially sound and give her dreams free rein.

Judith is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries such as canned goods, spices and noodles.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Judith dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

Juan is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. His family has been living in the countryside for many generations, and they have all been farmers. He has now inherited the family business and he is in charge of raising the pigs that are in the farm. This is something his father taught him to do.

The most important thing for this man is to make the business sustainable like it has been for many years and with this keep the family tradition which has helped to provide for all the members of his beautiful family. He is asking for a loan so he can buy more pigs; and some vitamins and food for them.

One of Juan’s biggest dreams is to repair the farm where he and his family lives, so that they can live more comfortably and safer. He just needs people to believe in his dreams and help him accomplish all his goals, and this loan will get him so much closer to that.

Jaime is 40 years old and lives in the municipality of Tierralta. He has four children, three daughters who are 1, 9 and 13 years old, and a son who is 7 years old. They are the reason for Jaime’s life, and why he wakes every day to work hard in his business, a farm that he owns where he grows different kind of products.

He’s an entrepreneur who dreams of having a big and successful business, and he’s aware that to accomplish that he not only has to work hard but he has to invest in the business. Right now he lacks the capital to do it, and that’s why he’s asking for a loan so he can buy some agricultural inputs and to pay for some technical assistance.

Jaime wants to see his children grow up to become excellent and professional people, and he knows that the best way to accomplish that is by investing in their education. That is his biggest dream. You can be part of Jaime’s success story; a loan will help him a lot.

Milagro is a 28-year-old untiring worker who tends a grocery store business. She works 15 hours a day, all with the dream of increasing her earnings to thus give her family, which consists of her partner with whom she lives in free union and their two daughters, ages 10 and 12, an excellent quality of life and to build a good future.

Her intention is to become the best storekeeper, one who stands out for her service to her customers and her good stock. She works day after day with this dream and hopes that her business continues being useful for the community.

Milagro is applying for a loan to stock her business with rice, sugar, raw cane sugar, coffee, bread, toilet paper, beans, lentils, oil, eggs, arepas [filled corn tortillas], pastas, chocolate (liquid for consumption), and potatoes, among other items.

Doris is from the city of Medellín. She has worked in commerce for 14 years. She is separated, and with the help of her mother she has paved the way, and now she is very well known in the sector where her business is located.

She sells beauty products by catalog and prepares food.

She is a very hard-working and striving person who wants to get ahead and have a life full of successes and triumphs.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of supplies and basic materials for perfumery and for preparing fast food so that she can improve her income through this work and can continue expanding her business in the best manner.

Noris is a humble, hard-working resident of the municipality of Medellín. Her life is full of dreams, hopes, and the best wishes for her family.

She is the mother of three children for whom she always had the courage and responsibility for making their lives the best.

Now she earns a living making and selling food. She transports these foods in a food cart. She works eight hours a day in her business.

Among the principal difficulties that she must face in her work are the strong rains and the high costs of the primary ingredients.

She is applying for a loan to purchase an umbrella to protect herself from the elements.

Luis is a 29-year-old, independent, single man who decided to make his own way and start a business selling women's accessories at economical prices, such as hair bands, headbands, necklaces, and earrings.

Luis lives in a humble area. People frequent his store because he sells his items at good prices. Now that the holiday season has arrived he is seeking economic support to stock his store with the aforementioned products.

Since 2010, Maria has found a formula for feeling useful and generating her own income. She achieved this thanks to selling products by catalog.

Maria is a responsible, hardworking and service-minded 29-year-old woman. She's proud of not needing to ask anyone for money because she supports herself.

She's seeking a loan to buy merchandise in bulk to increase her sales. This is an uncommon business in her neighborhood, so she spends six to eight hours a day on her work.

With your help, Maria will be able to increase her capital and have a better livelihood. Support her today!

Juan is a very happy man and an entrepreneurial person who loves what he does. He works selling borojo and pineapples, both which are very typical fruits in Colombia with excellent nutritional properties.

He lives in a civil union with his partner and has one son. He decided to sell these products because the market was saturated with vegetable sellers and he preferred to focus on only one product that he could sell wholesale. This is so that clients know that when they need cheap pineapples and borojos, he is the man who can sell them the produce.

He is requesting a loan to stock up on large quantities of these two products and hopes to improve his sales, establish good wholesale contacts for this season, the end of the year, and continue providing his family with a good quality of life.

Dubis is a hard-working, independent woman. She is a 31 year old mother of two children aged 6 and 9 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her partner. She is a patient, responsible, tolerant and careful person who works offering beauty services. Her business was born from economic necessity and she hopes to improve the living conditions of her family with it and pay for the education of her children.

She dreams of becoming an important businessperson, having the most popular business in her area, having employees and a large infrastructure. To enjoy her earnings buy a house, an automobile, crazy dreams that she wants to make reality. She knows that everything starts with imagining it and putting everything into achieving your objectives.

The client works mainly giving manicures and pedicures but she finds herself requesting a loan to expand the services of her business, buying fixed assets to offer hair cuts, styling and straightening, amongst others. She will buy hair washing equipment, chairs for hair-cutting and supplies like dye and treatments amongst others.

She hopes that with this investment she can get new clients and take advantage of the end of the year season.

Heinys is a 20-year-old woman who has a hair salon. She started her business with the hope of achieving financial liberty and independence. 

She is a modest woman who helps her mother with food expenses. She is paying for her beauty classes and wants to get ahead in life: to have a house and a car. She thinks that there is no better way of achieving her goal than through dedication to her own business. 

She is requesting a loan to renovate her store and buy chemicals for hair dying and straightening, which will improve her business' infrastructure and allow her to have more supplies to help her customers.

Huda is a 38-year-old married woman who opened, almost a year ago, a grocery shop to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and a woman who is prepared to accept sacrifices. She is trying hard to develop her business, and is succeeding.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season in order to better serve her customers.

She hopes to keep on expanding her business in the future in order to increase her income and provide her family with decent living conditions.

Walid specializes in organizing themed weddings and special occasions. His business is based on "Zaffeh," a tradition of Lebanese folkloric dancing and wedding processions.

He started this business three years ago, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can from his acquired income.

Sometimes, it is hard to achieve all your goals from a newly established business, so that's why an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help this ambitious 25-year-old man buy new special traditional costumes to provide his customers with diversified wedding-themed cultures.

Walid is very optimistic about this loan, and he is sure that in the future he will invest future loans into business development and expansion in a well-managed way.

Edward is married and has four children to support. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he practices cattle fattening as his main source of income. He has been in the business for the last 15 years and also tries to do some farming on a small scale.

He has applied for his Kiva loan of UGX 2,000,000 from Hofokam Limited to purchase more cows for his farm for better harvests and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

He hopes to expand his land as he starts carrying out farming on a large scale.

Titus is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cereals and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

Stephen is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the break down of the machine. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more maize. His business goal is to have more posho mills within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

Shazia is the age of 40 and is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son just set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers various types of mobile phones and accessories, and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in only a few days. 

Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of available funds. He wants to increase his inventory of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just started this business and does not have more cash on hand to purchase the desired inventory. This is the reason Shazia contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son. 

With the help of the loan, he can easily purchase mobiles accessories and extra recharge from various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family. 

Shazia is very thankful to lenders who take an active part in loan-raising.

Salma is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her family. He has been operating this business for many years, using wooden planks and bamboos which have been depreciated from time to time.

Salma's husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboos to continue his business. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Oscar, 47, is an employee. He grew up with his parents and has two children. His wife helps him with the household chores.

Oscar wakes up early and gets ready to go to work. He works all day, while his wife takes care of the household chores and of his children.

Oscar needs a loan to buy a mobile speaker to be able work and in that way increase his income.

Oscar dreams of having his own advertising company and teaching his children this activity, so that it becomes a successful family business in the Eastern region.

José, 42 years old, works in agriculture. He grew up with his parents who taught him this occupation. He is married and has two children who help him in the farming and livestock activities.

José gets up early to go to the fields where he works in the morning with his children while his wife carries out the household chores, and in the afternoon, he works as a motorist in a vehicle and also milks the cows that he possesses.

José needs the loan to buy a pair of bullocks to help him transport the harvest to his house and be able to plow the land in the future. He dreams of buying a vehicle.

Juan, 48, makes a living in agriculture and ranching, work he learned from his father. He studied up to the sixth grade. He is married. His wife dedicates herself to housework and his children help him plant and care for the cattle.

Juan gets up early to milk the cows and then he goes to work during the morning with his children in the parcel he rents. During the rest of the day he takes care of his animals and milks the cows.

Juan needs the loan in order to buy a heifer with which he hopes to increase the milk production and thus to begin producing dairy products.

Juan dreams of buying a plot of land in order to be able to pasture his animals and plant.

Kevin is 18 years old and is single. He is a very responsible person in his work. He works selling hats and he has been in this business for three years. Kevin is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise and obtain profit to excel and be able to study.

Donaldo is 39 years old. He is married with 3 children and he lives in the municipality of Yoro. Donaldo has always been a businessman. He's been in the business for 15 years selling gift shop items such as watches, glasses, purses, wallets, sashes, cell phone accessories, protectors and chargers and other items upon customers' requests.
He sells items door to door. This is his fourth loan with ODEF for 7,500 Lempiras that he will use to buy merchandize such as purses, cell phone accessories, wallets, watches and other items. He wants to use this loan to buy in cash and at discounted prices to sell during the holiday season and make some extra money. His future plan is to improve his house, so he stays motivated to keep on working.

Ángel is 38 years old. She doesn't have a high level of education and she is in a relationship and has two children, one of whom is studying in high school and the other is in elementary school.
Ángel had worked in agriculture along with her siblings since she was a child, but then she got into a relationship and her partner supported her financially to launch a small food business which she has now had for ten years. This stall is located in the market of her town. 
She needs the money from this loan in order to pay an architect who is helping her expand her business. Her aim is to improve her business, since improving it will increase her income and enable her to pay for her children's education.

Romeo, 29 years old, has his high school diploma, is single, and lives with his mother and a niece. He has been working for 15 years as a farmer of basic grains and in cattle ranching, and learned them both from his father.

He currently farms 14,000 square meters of land for corn and cattle. The land he farms is close to his home, and he works alongside his mother. These two activities generate the income they need to cover the household expenses.

Romeo needs a loan to purchase cattle to increase his herd. He dreams of studying to become a chef and would also like to continue investing to increase his herd of cattle.

María is 31-years old. She went to school until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a brick layer. They have one son, who has started school.

For the last year, María has had a store selling basic needs items. Through her business, she helps her husband financially. The store is located in her home, and nobody else is involved in the business. María starts work at six o'clock in the morning.

María needs the loan to purchase detergents and staple grains so she can expand her business. The loan will improve her sales because she will have more merchandise.

María hopes to have a larger store so that her customers can find all manner of products in one place.

Roberto, 28, went to primary school but couldn't continue his schooling due to economic difficulties. He lives with his life partner, who is a cosmetologist, and their son.

From a very young age, Roberto learned artisanal fishing. He does this every day from 3 a.m. to 6 p.m. with his brother, or sometimes alone. He has to rent a boat since he doesn't have his own. His partner works as a cosmetologist and does domestic work, thus helping him with household expenses.

The loan money will be used to buy a fishing boat because he wants to have his own to be comfortable for his work. His dream is to bring up his family and build his own home, as he is renting at the moment.

Mary Ann is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, bath soap and shampoo.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Rufino runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. Aside from that, he also sells assorted dry goods, kitchenware and assorted plastic toys whenever there is an occasion like the town fiesta and other gatherings.

He is 45-year-old married man and has five children. His oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 1. He would like to boost his income by purchasing a variety of goods intended for special occasions. He has requested a loan to buy kitchenware, plasticware and assorted toys. With these, more customers will shop in his store. In that way, he will able to manage his finances and set aside some of his profit for future use. 
 
Rufino is determined that he could make his business more productive to improve the living conditions of his family.

Franklin is 26 years old. His civil status is single. He is a person who is very responsible and persevering in his work, He works selling boots for farm work. He has been working in this business for three years.

Franklin is applying for the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus obtain earnings to continue meeting his needs and those of his little household.

Dilcia is a very hardworking woman, who was taught that work is essential since she was very little. She is married and lives with her husband and their three children who are all in school, and her husband works as a vehicle driver.

She earns a living selling clothes, cosmetics and jewelry. She has been, and is, a very friendly person that knows a lot of people; people that today are her customers. She also sells snacks in her home since she maintains her business at her home and she is serving her customers all day.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes; to buy shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, dresses, underwear, etc. to sell during the Christmas season. Dilcia's dream is to have a variety store, and also that her children keep studying and become great people in the future.

Nickson is a 26-year-old hardworking married man with two children, a devoted father who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of one dependent.

He used his previous loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas and other items to sell. He carries out produce, where he mainly sells coffee to earn a living. He supplements this with motorcycle transport and a butcher shop to earn extra income and have improved standards of living for his family.

His dream is to expand his businesses to earn more income in order to educate his children and equip them with skills. His main challenges are inadequate capital and customers.

He desires to use the loan facility to buy more cows for slaughtering during the festive season.

Julie is a 32 year old single mother of a six year old son. She works at a private company, and for three years she has been alternately selling diverse merchandise, a business she learned from her mother who is a merchant. She works doing this since she has no husband, and she wanted to be able to support her household. She sells purses, bed sheets, bedspreads, clothing items, fragrances, personal care products and an ample line of items, to her acquaintances, friends and work colleagues. She buys in Maicao, a municipality of la Guajira. Currently, she applied to a loan, a Credikiva, an opportunity to join the financial life through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to fulfill some orders for bed sheets, towels, bedspreads, custom jewelry. Julie is an optimistic young woman who wants to finish her college education and offer her son an excellent future.

Cassandra graduated from cosmetology school in September. She decided to start practicing as an esthetician immediately, since a close family friend had a spot for her at a local hair salon, Alante Hair Design. Since the salon is already well-established, Cassandra has access to a large clientele base.

Ever since she was a little girl, she wanted to be a makeup artist. She wasn’t able to start right away because her parents taught her that if she wanted something, she had to work hard for it. After realizing that she wanted to become a business owner, she went full force with her dreams and everything has fallen into place.

She will use her Kiva loan to purchase inventory for the holiday season, as the salon owner has warned her they are very busy during this time of year.

In the future, Cassandra would like to have a mobile service salon by purchasing a mobile utility truck. This truck would have a full-service salon and would go to the client, as opposed to a storefront.

With Kiva lenders' help, Cassandra will be able to provide service to clients and grow her business so she can fulfill her dreams.

Mohammad is a 24-year-old, single man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the sole breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for his support.

Mohammad has a stall in the city where he sells clothing. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell from his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually let him save enough income to expand his business.

Zhanna lives with her beloved husband in the city of Vanadzor of the Lori region. They have a son who lives abroad. Zhanna works at a private workshop as a tailor. Her husband is also employed and he is a computer operator. Zhanna mentions that the flat where her family lives has not been repaired for many years and especially during winter period, with the wooden old windows and with the absence of a heating system, the colds seem to be endless and winter months pass very slowly. 

Now she greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with a loan to solve this problem. This loan of 400,000 Armenian drams she will use for buying a heating boiler and of course she will finally settle the heating system in her flat.

In Vanadzor city of the Lori region lives Gagik, with his wife and two children (the elder is a student and the smallest is school-aged). Gagik has higher education with a specialty of architecture, but he works not of his profession; he sells jewelry in Vanadzor’s jewelry market at the rented stall. He sells rings, bracelets, and earrings. He also sells crosses and medallions, which he buys from the local jewelers in the city of Yerevan. One of his business challenges is seasonality. For example, there are fewer weddings at the end of autumn and more during the New Year’s holidays. So there are periods when he has very little income from his business.  

Gagik has been in this business for 7 years already and he is rather popular with the nice and stylish jewelry on his stall. So with great hope of having more sales near to the New Year’s period he asks for this loan in order to buy a new, fashionable, and elegant assortment of jewelry and attract a lot of customers for purchases.

Edita has been involved in the retail clothing business for two years. She organizes her sales from the house, where she lives with her husband and two school age children.

Edita works hard to satisfy her customers' demand and go in line with the market. The requested loan is very important for her to purchase a new stock of winter clothing to resell to customers. She hopes to receive lenders' support and develop her business, because the income she earns is vital for her family's living.

Florance is a group leader, aged 41. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 17 years. The group is called TWUBAKANE which means “Let us build each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business to make more profits for them to have a better future. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to pay medical insurance.

Malkhaz, 39 years old, is from Bolnisi. He has a wife and little daughter and son. The only source of income for the family is from their agricultural activity. They own a plot of agricultural land and four pigs and the income is too insignificant for a four-member family. Malkhaz needs financial assistance to be involved in another stable business and tackle the financial difficulties.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Malkhaz has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With the loan amount, Malkhaz will purchase a second-hand car and will start serving local people as a taxi driver.
The loan will greatly assist Malkhaz and his family members. He will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

Dauglas is 24 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for 3 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to educate his children.
His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his motorcycle transport business, make more income, and be able to educate his children at the university.

Maria is 38 years old and lives at home with her husband and four children. For 10 years she has been engaged in the making and selling of "pupusas". Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers. With the profits she makes she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork rinds, fresh cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients, so she will be able to have better earnings for a better economic stability.

Jose is 49 years old and lives with his daughter in a house that he owns. He has earned his living selling women's and men's clothing for more than 20 years. His business is located in the municipal market and he has many customers because of the variety of products that he sells. With the sales he makes, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan for the purchase of more clothing at wholesale in order to continue with his sales and thereby have a better income.

Paul is a first time borrower who is a resident of Gayaza. He owns a company where he builds houses and rents it to people. He has approached UGAFODE for financing to complete one of his recently built houses. He has applied for a loan of UGX3,000,000 which will help him buy construction materials to complete his house. There is no problem offering it to him, given his good character and public reputation.

For the two hectares that he operates, Mihigo asks for a loan that will allow him to carry out maintenance works. He has been a rice grower since 2000, only two years after the second war that hit the region. The misery was such that he decided with his wife to devote themselves to agriculture in order to meet their family's needs. As a result, his housing improved and he acquired two fields of two hectares each. Even though the farming of this area requires more means than he has, he wishes in future, to gain 5 hectares in order to respond favorably to the family burdens and to send his children to school, through to university level.

Pllumb or 'Pigeon' in English is a married father of four. His children range in age between 7 and 15 years old. He has been photographed with the three younger ones. He has been running a grocery store for about two and a half years now, and the reason for this loan is that he wants to stock up on inventory and replace a cash register. Even though he lives in a village, he does not own land which he would consider as a source of income. In the 2,000 square meters yard that he does have, he can only plant for the family's consumption and he has some orchards which are also for family use. 

From the store activity he makes approximately 200 USD per month; income that is considered the monthly minimum here in Albania. His wife works in a shoe factory for 102 USD a month which is way below the minimum. 

Pllumb's family lived in Greece for long time until three years ago when the Greek economy crashed and they lost their jobs. With the little savings they had, they built the store and on the second floor is their home.

Jhon Jairo is a young student who lives with his parents, siblings and aunt. His father is a drywall system operator, his mother is a cook. Neither of them have stable jobs and their income isn't set.

He is studying Textile Quality Control. He decided to study this major because he wants to expand his knowledge of textiles, since previously he took classes in Textile Mechanics. These classes will allow him to specialize even more and practice his profession. This major will also allow to bring his family a better quality of life, because it is one of the majors that is most in demand now in Peru.

It is going very well for him in his studies. He spends 35 hours a week at it and has 2 years and a half left to go. When he finishes his major he would like to work at an important company in the area, in charge if fabric development and Quality Control.

Due to the difficult situation his family is going through (his parents' low income), Jhon is turning KIVA so they can help him pay off his pending debts, thus giving his parents the peace of mind of seeing their son finish his major in the estimated time. Finishing his major will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life with better work opportunities.

Jhon wants to say some words of gratitude to the KIVA investors for the support offered: "I feel very happy and grateful for the support I am being offered, I will not let you down and I wish you success in everything. Thank you, KIVA, for letting me make my dream come true of continuing to study to become a great professional.

Fidaa is a 25-year-old married mother of two. Two years ago, she started sewing shoes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is becoming well-known in her region.

Fidaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house's roof before winter. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Mirna is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children, both dependents. The family lives in the Trojes community, in the east of Honduras. The family owns a house. For two years, Mirna has worked selling groceries.

Mirna is applying for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, spaghetti, sauce, limes and more. Mirna is enterprising and wants to move forward. She hopes to stock up her business. She also wants to buy pigs to fatten up. Mirna hopes to expand her business further and earn higher profits with the support of this loan.

One of Mirna's dreams is to expand her business and to improve her and her family's quality of life.

Trojes, Honduras; November 2015

Marie started working as a retailer in 1993, learning from family and friends. This business helps her to improve her standard of living, despite the small size of her working capital. She plans to work with PAIDEK in order to improve her family's life more and more.

In the photo, Marie is wearing a black blouse and scarf.

Rene, who is 31 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has worked raising basic grains for 10 years. With the sales that he makes, he manages to pay some household expenses.

He wants to improve his home by cementing the floor and replacing the roof, but as he doesn't have sufficient capital, he is applying for a loan for the purchase of the necessary construction materials to be able to have a more comfortable and safe home.

Luis is 29 years old, married, and has a 4-year-old son who is his responsibility. He is dedicated to selling perishable goods. For the time, he requests a loan from ADIM and from Kiva members for his development. He will invest in buying high-quality and low-quality bananas and fuel, which will be used for transportation. Thus, he is sure that he will be able to increase his sales and his earnings to improve and offer a better life to his family.

Timoteo is 45 years years old and is in a common-law relationship. His spouse makes handicrafts to help her husband. They have three children, Marlon is 16 years old, Julián is 10 and Maykerly is 6. They study in schools in their area.

He works very hard selling rugs, walking and carrying the products on his back, traveling around the different towns and cities. He claims that it is much easier to find a client through itinerant sales than waiting for them to come to you in a shop to buy.

With the money Timoteo will buy merchandise, coffee tables and rugs. He hopes to sell more products in this season, obtaining greater profit to continue to cover the family's basic necessities. In the future he would like to have a motorcycle to continue with his business.

Segundo is 37 years old and Afro-Ecuadorian. He’s married and has three sons. He lives in a rural town called Lita, located in northern Ecuador. He works selling “cocadas”, a regional candy made of coconut.

This activity is the only income for all of the family. His wife and his children work in the evenings making the candies. His wife works selling cocadas too, but she works in buses. His oldest son is 18 years old and works every day with his father. The other kids are 8 and 12 respectively; both of them go to school.

Segundo needs this loan to buy supplies for his product and increase his stock. He knows that the loan is necessary to support all his family and appreciates your help.

Maria, 42, lives with her common-law husband who is a radio technician. She has a three-year-old daughter, Madison, who stays with her mother while she sells candies at the market in a small stall she has been running for 15 years. She arrives at work very early with the hope of selling her products to make enough money to help her partner cover the main household expenses.

Maria is in need of money to buy goods wholesale to improve her sales and earn more income to continue covering her main necessities.

Danelia’s passion is a medical career. She’s a young twenty-six year old woman who loves to help others; that’s why she decided to become a general practitioner. But the high cost of studying this at university inspired her to start a business selling steel items. She would sell them alongside used clothing and then be able to pay for her studies.

Now Danelia has already spent six years in this business, is married, has a six-month-old baby, and works as a doctor in a private hospital. However, she wants to invest more in her business. That’s why she’s asking for a loan to buy stainless steel necklaces, rings, earrings, and second-hand clothing. She believes that the more she invests, the more it will grow economically; this way, she’ll be able to secure her baby’s future. In the future, she dreams of starting more businesses, perhaps selling new clothing.

Jario produces dry grains and is also the owner of a small grocery store which is located in his house. He is the father of two young children who both depend on him. In the past Jairo has received other loans, which he has used to buy agricultural products and also products such as maize, coffee, sugar, and more. This new loan that Jairo is asking for will be used to invest in his store and to buy plastic, aluminium and steel products, with which he hopes to increase his profits during this Christmas period. In the future Jairo hopes to continue receiving new loans in order to keep enjoying his business and improving his home.

Heytel is a 25 year old farmer with great aspirations in life. For 5 years he has been working growing and harvesting bananas which he hopes in the near future to export to the United States. For the moment he is requesting a loan to buy urea and diesel fuel, products which he needs for his crops and for irrigating in the summer. In the future Heytel hopes to acquire a micro- sprinkler system which would allow him to improve the quality of his crops.

A grocery store and banana cultivation are the principal sources of income for Danys, a 44 year old woman with grand aspirations for her businesses. For five years she's worked at the grocery store, but the planting of bananas is a relatively new venture for her, something she started only one year ago. The loan Danys is requesting she requires to purchase various products for the grocery store and banana plantation, that she hopes will continue to grow. Her plans for the future are to have a well stocked grocery store and to sell her bananas to neighboring Honduras.

15 years ago Ronald and his brothers ventured into the business of banana cultivation. He currently works alone, nevertheless this has not impeded him from growing and expanding, since buyers seek out Ronaldo coming from Honduras and El Salvador to acquire his products. The loan Ronaldo is requesting he requires to invest in his business through the purchase of agriculture products which indispensable to any agrarian.

Deisy is 35 years old. She is married and has two children of 10 and 18 years of age. Her business is selling second-hand clothes.

She is friendly, talkative, and very enterprising. She conducts her business in the "Juancho" neighborhood, which is characterized by taking in the population that survived the river's flood years before. Today, it has become a the manufacturing hub with a warm, tropical and humid climate.

Daisy has a dark complexion, brown eyes and a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish because of general culture, and at her work. She enjoys life accompanied by her husband, who works in construction, and her children, who attend school. They live in a rented room constructed from brick with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. The house has drinking water, electric power, and sewage. She works selling second-hand clothes, which she does buying clothes in bundles to separate them by gender and displaying them on boxes or by hanging them on the wall. "Before, buying second-hand clothes was related to poverty. That has changed and today it is a commercial alternative," she says. Her business is successful because it has a strong public demand. The advantage of her business is that the price is accessible. The disadvantage is the lack of display cases to exhibit her merchandise. Her dream is for her store to be well-known by many people. She wants to buy two display cases. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 7 years she has been working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Deisy is asking for a loan to buy two display cases to exhibit clothes in the window.

Lourdes continues with her neighborhood store business. The loan she received she used to buy shelves and groceries in bulk. She made her payments on time because she worked at her business constantly. Currently, her business has new shelves where she organizes and places food. The space that she uses is small, but there is a way to expand it to enlarge the atmosphere and the business. "I need to make my business bigger, enlarging the atmosphere of my store so that more products and clients can enter," she says. Her business is successful because she carries the necessary food items for daily purposes. The advantage of her business is that the store is open every day and clients buy on a daily basis. The disadvantage is the lack of space to enlarge the business. Her dream is to better her business. She wants to expand her neighborhood store by building a wall. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the year that she has been working in this business.

For these reasons, Lourdes is asking for a loan to construct a wall to enlarge the atmosphere of her neighborhood store and to give her security.

Adrián is a young student of Mechanical Production, a career he decided to study because he likes everything to do with mechanics and production processes. His studies are going well, he only has 7 months left until he can complete his studies. He dedicates 45 hours per week to his studies, both theory and practical.

When he completes his studies he is thinking of working in a company that allows him to develop a career path to develop his knowledge, acquiring experience. Later he plans to start an industrial mechanical company.

His main life's dreams are: validate his courses with the university, specializing in engineering to later form a company and support his family.

During the past months Adrián's family has been going through a difficult economic situation as his parents don't have stable employment. For this reason he is resorting to Kiva so they can help him with this loan and in this way cover his outstanding debt. This loan will help him a lot as it will provide him with tranquility of mind. He can dedicate himself more to his studies and not worry so much about his monthly payments as with this help payment will be easier.

Finally, Adrián wants to express a few words of appreciation for the support he has been provided with. "I feel very happy and grateful that there are people, who without knowing you, support you to get ahead, achieve your goals and dreams. For people who sometimes don't have the economic resources and fall short. I thank you very much for the help you provide. It benefits us a lot. Not only me but the whole surroundings as with this support we study and it allows us to be more conscious and better trained to make the best decisions in all aspects of our lives. Thanks KIVA!".

Chhailoeurn is a 20-year-old single man who lives in Banteay Meanchey province. He grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. He can earn 11 USD per day and saves about 3 USD each day after daily expenses.

His farming business is challenged by damaged caused by pests.

Chhailoeurn wishes to continue studying at the university. He requests a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees and school supplies. He hopes that this loan will enable him to pursue his dream job after he graduates and to get a good salary to support his family.

Issouf is thirty-two years old and has been a Malian sheep farmer for more than nine years. He is seen in the photo holding the sheep's horn. Issouf is married and has three children. He dreams of being able to buy livestock for his children in the future. Despite never having attended school, Issouf is a good livestock raiser. His wife works as a peanut grower.

Issouf has requested this loan from the field partner, RMCR (with whom he has successfully worked for more than three years), to improve the finances of his business. He will buy sheep and feed for them from the weekly markets in his region. After fattening them up, he will sell them on in the main town. His loans have always been repaid correctly and he earns an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA. Issouf is very pleased with his business as it generates good profits and also provides organic fertilizer for his fields.

Soleyma is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her daughter and her husband who works and helps her economically. She has worked selling clothing like pants, sports jerseys, stockings, etc. for nine years. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has lots of clients due to the quality of her clothing and her good prices. The client is once again requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale as her sales are going well and doing this she can have greater economic income.

Adelina is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her two children are in school, while one is working. Adelina’s husband is a caregiver in other country. With her aspiration to help her husband to uplift their living, Adelina engage herself in food vending business. Adelina is selling street foods for eight years. She is receiving monthly remittance from her husband but she uses it to improve their house, and some of it for her children needs in school.

Adelina wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy raw meat, ingredients and materials use in her food vending business. Adelina will use her earnings to support her children's other needs for their studies.

The Karla Group, coordinated by 35-year-old Karla who is single and responsible for her three children, is made up of women business owners who are examples of women who struggle and overcome. 

It's her dream to have her own beauty salon where she is delighted to offer services to her beloved customers.
